SE450: Why is Output Corrupted? [21/36]

  • Sometimes program gets stuck and doesn't complete
  • Can see problem better when turning debugging on
    queue.setDebug(true);

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/ThreadTester.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: /**
00003:    This program runs two threads in parallel.
00004: */
00005: public class ThreadTester
00006: {
00007:    public static void main(String[] args)
00008:    {
00009:       BoundedQueue<String> queue = new BoundedQueue<String>(10);
00010:       queue.setDebug(true);
00011:       final int GREETING_COUNT = 100;
00012:       Runnable run1 = new Producer("Hello, World!", 
00013:             queue, GREETING_COUNT);
00014:       Runnable run2 = new Producer("Goodbye, World!", 
00015:             queue, GREETING_COUNT);
00016:       Runnable run3 = new Consumer(queue, 2 * GREETING_COUNT);
00017:       
00018:       Thread thread1 = new Thread(run1);
00019:       Thread thread2 = new Thread(run2);
00020:       Thread thread3 = new Thread(run3);
00021: 
00022:       thread1.start();
00023:       thread2.start();
00024:       thread3.start();
00025:    }
00026: }
00027: 
00028:

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/Producer.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: /**
00003:    An action that repeatedly inserts a greeting into a queue.
00004: */
00005: public class Producer implements Runnable
00006: {
00007:    /**
00008:       Constructs the producer object.
00009:       @param aGreeting the greating to insert into a queue
00010:       @param aQueue the queue into which to insert greetings
00011:       @param count the number of greetings to produce
00012:    */
00013:    public Producer(String aGreeting, BoundedQueue<String> aQueue, int count)
00014:    {
00015:       greeting = aGreeting;
00016:       queue = aQueue;
00017:       greetingCount = count;
00018:   }
00019: 
00020:    public void run()
00021:    {
00022:       try
00023:       {
00024:          int i = 1;
00025:          while (i <= greetingCount)
00026:          {
00027:             if (!queue.isFull())
00028:             {
00029:                queue.add(i + ": " + greeting);
00030:                i++;
00031:             }
00032:             Thread.sleep((int) (Math.random() * DELAY));         
00033:          }
00034:       }
00035:       catch (InterruptedException exception)
00036:       {
00037:       }
00038:    }
00039: 
00040:    private String greeting;
00041:    private BoundedQueue<String> queue;
00042:    private int greetingCount;
00043: 
00044:    private static final int DELAY = 10;
00045: }
00046:

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/Consumer.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: /**
00003:    An action that repeatedly removes a greeting from a queue.
00004: */
00005: public class Consumer implements Runnable
00006: {
00007:    /**
00008:       Constructs the consumer object.
00009:       @param aQueue the queue from which to retrieve greetings
00010:       @param count the number of greetings to consume
00011:    */
00012:    public Consumer(BoundedQueue<String> aQueue, int count)
00013:    {
00014:       queue = aQueue;
00015:       greetingCount = count;
00016:    }
00017: 
00018:    public void run()
00019:    {
00020:       try
00021:       {
00022:          int i = 1;
00023:          while (i <= greetingCount)
00024:          {
00025:             if (!queue.isEmpty())
00026:             {
00027:                String greeting = queue.remove();
00028:                System.out.println(greeting);
00029:                i++;
00030:             }
00031:             Thread.sleep((int)(Math.random() * DELAY));
00032:          }
00033:       }
00034:       catch (InterruptedException exception)
00035:       {
00036:       }
00037:    }
00038: 
00039:    private BoundedQueue<String> queue;
00040:    private int greetingCount;
00041: 
00042:    private static final int DELAY = 10;
00043: }
00044:

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/BoundedQueue.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: import java.util.ArrayList;
00003: /** 
00004:     A first-in, first-out bounded collection of objects. 
00005: */ 
00006: public class BoundedQueue<E>
00007: { 
00008:    /** 
00009:        Constructs an empty queue. 
00010:        @param capacity the maximum capacity of the queue 
00011:    */ 
00012:    public BoundedQueue(int capacity) 
00013:    { 
00014:       elements = new ArrayList<E>(capacity); 
00015:       head = 0; 
00016:       tail = 0; 
00017:       size = 0;
00018:    } 
00019: 
00020:    /** 
00021:        Removes the object at the head. 
00022:        @return the object that has been removed from the queue
00023:        @precondition !isEmpty()
00024:    */ 
00025:    public E remove() 
00026:    { 
00027:       if (debug) System.out.print("removeFirst");
00028:       E r = elements.get(head); 
00029:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00030:       head++;
00031:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00032:       size--;
00033:       if (head == elements.size()) 
00034:       {
00035:          if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00036:          head = 0; 
00037:       }
00038:       if (debug) 
00039:          System.out.println("head=" + head + ",tail=" + tail 
00040:             + ",size=" + size);
00041:       return r; 
00042:    } 
00043: 
00044:    /** 
00045:        Appends an object at the tail. 
00046:        @param newValue the object to be appended 
00047:        @precondition !isFull();
00048:    */ 
00049:    public void add(E newValue) 
00050:    { 
00051:       if (debug) System.out.print("add");
00052:       elements.set(tail,newValue); 
00053:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00054:       tail++;
00055:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00056:       size++;
00057:       if (tail == elements.size()) 
00058:       {
00059:          if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00060:          tail = 0; 
00061:       }
00062:       if (debug) 
00063:          System.out.println("head=" + head + ",tail=" + tail 
00064:             + ",size=" + size);
00065:    } 
00066: 
00067:    public boolean isFull() 
00068:    { 
00069:      return size == elements.size();
00070:    } 
00071: 
00072:    public boolean isEmpty() 
00073:    { 
00074:       return size == 0; 
00075:    } 
00076: 
00077:    public void setDebug(boolean newValue)
00078:    {
00079:       debug = newValue;
00080:    }
00081: 
00082:    private ArrayList<E> elements; 
00083:    private int head; 
00084:    private int tail; 
00085:    private int size;
00086:    private boolean debug;
00087: }
00088:
